description: Ms. composite codex. Title from both texts. Manuscript erroneously foliated beginning on the front flyleaf. Record follows erroneous foliation. Physical description: Text 1, 14 lines per page; written in naskh with elements of nastaʻliq in black on tan glazed, laid Arabic paper; rubrication in green and catchwords. Text 2, 17-19 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on tan glazed, laid Arabic paper; rubrication and catchwords; hand changes on leaf 238a; leaves 80-83 are replacements. Some damp-staining and a few repairs, particularly at the beginning and end of each text. Origin: Text 1, 16 Rabīʻ I 985 H [3 June 1577] (leaf 77a). Text 2, 22 Rabīʻ I 972 H [28 October 1564] (leaf 266a).
abstract: Collection of two texts on Shiʻite law.
extent: 266 leaves : paper ; 180 x 120 (120-132 x 73-79) mm bound to 183 x 125 mm
title: Nuzhat al-nāẓir fī al-jamʻ bayna al-ashyāʼ wa-al-naẓāʼir. Kitāb al-Intiṣār
provenance: Owner's stamp and partially effaced note on leaf 77a, as well as two birth notices from the 19th century. Owners' notes and a stamp on leaf 79a, two of which bear the dates 1127 H and 1150 H.
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Three-quarter red leather with black leather covers; blind-stamped central mandorla and fillets.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
